'Geography and cartography in medieval Islam' refers to the advancement of
geography, cartography and the earth sciences in the medieval Islamic
civilization.

After its beginnings in the 8th century based on Hellenistic
geography, Gerald R. Tibbetts, The Beginnings of a Cartographic Tradition,
in: John Brian Harley, David Woodward: Cartography in the Traditional Islamic
and South Asian Societies, Chicago, 1992, pp. 90â107 (97-100), ISBN 0-226-31635-

Various Islamic scholars contributed to its development, and the most notable
